text: [Music]
after years on the run Joaquin el chapo
guzman perhaps the world's most wanted
man is in the hands of the authorities
flanked by members of the security
forces and dressed in dark jeans he
looked almost identical to the few
images which have emerged of the elusive
drug lord in recent years outwardly the
Mexican government kept up a cool
exterior but in the president's inner
circle the sense of excitement was
palpable
early this morning elements from the
Navy detained Joaquin Guzman in the city
of mazatl√°n investigators from the
attorney general's office have formally
identified him he's been checked by
doctors and will be transferred to the
corresponding prison not only is Guzman
one of the most wanted drug lords in the
world he is also one of the wealthiest
amassing a personal fortune thought to
be in excess of a billion dollars
he was even included in the list of the
world's 100 richest people in Forbes
magazine capturing probably the biggest
name in drug trafficking since Pablo
Escobar is undoubtedly a massive shot in
the arm for the Pena Nieto
administration but on the streets of the
capital people greeted the news of the
arrest with mixed feelings unlike the
last government under him we saw many
deaths on all sides
organized crime civilians and police now
we haven't seen so many killed I think
instead they're using intelligence to
locate and capture the drug lords
Guzman is not the only boss if they have
captured him and are going to jail him
well somebody else will take his place
another mafia boss or drug baron
arresting el chapo guzman is a major
step both symbolically and strategically
one which the authorities hope will make
an important dent in his organization
nevertheless there are still important
leaders of the Sinaloa cartel who are
more than willing to step into gusman's
shoes this is not the first time that el
chapo guzman has been captured by the
Mexican authorities according to popular
myth he escaped from a high-security
prison in 2001 by hiding in a laundry
basket but this time around the
government will be doing everything in
its power to ensure he doesn't slip
through their fingers twice we'll grant
BBC News Mexico City
